questions.question: Even though she is a graduate, she cannot put her ideas ......................... in English.
If you want to lose weight, you must cut ............................ on your consumption of fast food.
questions.description: To cut down is to reduce.

questions.question: They have ............................... the meeting.
questions.description: To put off is to postpone.

questions.question: He .................................. after a prolonged battle with cancer.
questions.description: To pass away is to die.

questions.question: Nobody can .................................... with him. He has such a short temper.
questions.description: To get along is to have good relation with

questions.question: I will get that job if you .............................. a word for me.
questions.description: To put in a word is to recommend.

questions.question: You should stop running me .................................
questions.description: To run somebody down is to criticize them severely.

questions.question: They fought bravely but in the end they had to ...............................
questions.description: To give in is to surrender.

questions.question: The speaker was going to conclude his address but the audience wanted him to ................................ for another fifteen minutes.
questions.description: To go on is to continue.

questions.question: I couldn't .................................. what she said.
questions.description: To figure out is to understand.
